remarks: Applying the exponential function to an infinite sum yields an infinite product.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 11-Feb-2018.)
statement:
iprodefisum.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
iprodefisum.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
iprodefisum.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = B ) $.
iprodefisum.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> B e. CC ) $.
iprodefisum.5 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , F ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
iprodefisum $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. Z ( exp ` B ) = ( exp ` sum_ k e. Z B ) ) $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
